description.narrative:
Centre for Indigenous knowledge research and Development (CIRD) is a VNGO and the coordinating organisation of the Forestry land coalition. In 2016, CIDRD and Forland will continue to advocate for 3 issues that have been advocating since 2015, they are including:advocacy for revision of law on forest protection, monitoring process of returning land from SFEs to local ethnic minority community, and advocacy for developing the framework of evaluation of effectiveness of decree 99 on Payment of forest environmental services. Beside of that, they also carrying out some activities to improve their member capacity.
For the revision of forest protection law, the coalition is cooperate with Vietnam Union of Science and Technology Association (VUSTA) and the Committee of of Science, Technology and Environment of National Assembly to advocate for the rights of household and communities in access to the natural forest.
For the monitoring of return the land from state owned forest enterprise, the coalition will work in two provinces of Quang Binh and Gia Lai to set up the monitoring mechanism. After piloting, this mechanism will propose to the Central farther land front for duplication.

participating-org.narrative: CIRD (Center for Indigenous Knowledge Research and Development) is an NGO registered under Vietnam Union of Science and Technology Association (VUSTA). CIRD strengthens the Key farmer networking to empower indigenous communities socially and economically. CIRD seeks every opportunity to develop and spread strategies to contribute to capacity building, confidence, self-determination and self-management of the community of ethnic minorities through the Key farmer network. CIRD strengthens the Key farmernetworking to empower indigenous communities socially and economically. CIRD strives to meet women#s practical needs for material and spiritual well-being, as well as get the recognition of their strategic role improving their involvement in the decision-making process within their families and communities.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
